review_text:
Jim's historic lodgings reminded me so much of childhood visits to my great-grandmother's home :) The bathroom fixtures, the building materials, even the creaks and smell were similar! I loved the shower in the cast iron tub and i was pleasantly surprised by the volume of hot water available. There were plenty of fluffy soft towels available.
The tiny kitchenette is tucked into a corner and fully stocked with a Keurig, a variety of coffee and tea, plenty of dishes and utensils, a large dormitory fridge and a small microwave. The perfectly sized television it fits neatly in the builtin wooden bookcase and there are many cable channels available for those who choose to watch it. Only these barest of modern necessities have been provided without sacraficing the overall feel for the sake of modern conveniences.
The elegant 4-poster bed dominates the bedroom. I slept well and really enjoyed the extra touch of real feather-down pillows! The extra fleece blanket on the daybed came in handy also. Houses that are over a hundred years old tend to be a bit drafty and damp, and this one is no exception. I expected this and brought my own extra throw blanket.
This stay is definitely an experience; a walk back in time. If you enjoy the ambience of historic homes, if you find old European hotels quaint and charming, you will love your visit to Jim's place. If you prefer all the comforts and feel of a nice, new hotel, this is not the stay you are looking for.
